channel.title: forensics on It's a Dev's world
channel.description: Recent content in forensics on It's a Dev's world

item.title: Android Forensics Tools
item.description: Android Forensics Tools My personal compilation of tools for Android Forensics and Analysis. I will be extending this list. ADB Useful to interact with Android devices via the command line. ðŸ”— Download ADB Commands: adb devices # List connected devices adb shell # Start shell on device adb install .\app-debug.apk # Install app adb pull /sdcard/data.txt # Copy file from device adb push # Ex (adb push .\frida-server-16.7.14-android-x86_64 /data/local/tmp/) adb logcat # View device logs LiME (Linux Memory Extractor) Dumping volatile memory from Android devices.

item.title: USB Detection in Windows
item.description: Windows Event Logs Security Event Logs 6416 â€“ A new external device was recognized by the system. 4663 â€“ An attempt was made to access an object (useful to monitor file access on USB drives). 4656 â€“ A handle to an object was requested. 4624 / 4634 â€“ Logon/logoff events to correlate user activity with USB usage. System Event Logs From the Microsoft-Windows-DriverFrameworks-UserMode/Operational log: 20001 â€“ A USB device was connected.
